commando.runCommand.title: Commando: Run command
commando.configuration.title: Commando Configuration
commando.configuration.autoClear.title: Auto clear
commando.configuration.autoClear.descrip: If true, automatically clear the output channel or terminal after each command.
commando.configuration.autoFocus.title: Auto focus
commando.configuration.autoFocus.descrip: If true, automatically focus the output channel or terminal after each command.
commando.configuration.runOnTerminal.des: If true, run commands on terminal. Otherwise, run commands on background and show the result in output channel.
commando.configuration.windowName.title: Window name
commando.configuration.windowName.descri: The name of the output channel or terminal. You can use predefined variables.
commando.configuration.shell.title: Shell
commando.configuration.shell.description: The shell to use for running commands. If empty, the default shell is used. This setting is only available when runOnTerminal is false.
commando.configuration.commands.title: Commands
commando.configuration.commands.descript: The list of commands to run.
commando.configuration.commands.item.nam: The name of the command. This is used to identify the command. This must be unique.
commando.configuration.commands.item.des: The description of the command. This is used to show the command in the command palette.
commando.configuration.commands.item.cmd: The command to run. You can use predefined variables.
commando.configuration.commands.item.aut: If true, automatically clear the output channel or terminal after each command. If null, use the value of commando.autoClear.
If true, automatically focus the output channel or terminal after each command. If null, use the value of commando.autoFocus.
commando.configuration.commands.item.run: If true, run commands on terminal. Otherwise, run commands on background and show the result in output channel. If null, use the value of commando.runOnTerminal.
commando.configuration.commands.item.she: The shell to use for running commands. If empty, the default shell is used. This setting is only available when runOnTerminal is false. If null, use the value of commando.shell.
commando.configuration.commands.item.win: The name of the output channel or terminal. You can use predefined variables. If null, use the value of commando.windowName.
